description: Design District houses permanent and purpose-designed creative workspaces across a cluster of 16 gloriously eclectic buildings, designed by eight pioneering architects. Just one minute from North Greenwich station, the district is a thriving home for creative businesses.

factsheet.heading: Design District
paragraphs: This year, Design District, London’s permanent home for the creative industries, continues its alignment with Open House Festival, once again becoming a key hub of activity.

On 18 September, Design District will unlock the inner workings of the 150k sq ft site, guiding visitors around it's 14 buildings, with a route to creativity. From ceramic and design workshops to specialist food and beverage options at Bureau and Canteen, the curated event series broadens access to creative experiences and the London-based companies shaping these industries.

Visitors are invited to start their day with a complimentary coffee at Design District’s on-site restaurant, Bureau, before being taken on an Open Studios Tour of 5 key businesses based at the District:

- Adẹ̀kọ́ & Co: An independent design studio founded in 2014 by Creative Director Tolu Adẹ̀kọ́, specialising in architecture and interior design, with a focus on storytelling through space and materiality.
- Engage Works: A creative technology agency founded by Steve Blyth in 2005, specialising in crafting innovative physical and virtual brand experiences.

- Haberdashery: Founded by Ben Rigby and David Foster, this design studio specialises in unique, light-based installations that blend artistry with technology, transforming spaces into visually stunning environments.

- Ryan London: Founded by Ryan Mathys, this premium leather goods brand specialises in handcrafted, high-quality bags and accessories, offering luxurious and meticulously designed products that combine style and functionality.

- Wizard Works: Founded by Harry Major and Veronica Adamson, this dynamic company specialises in handcrafted, stylish, and functional bike bags and accessories for cyclists who value quality and aesthetics

name: Design District
